intro: Barkania stipulacea var. bullata, commonly known as the bullate barkania, is a rare and unique plant species belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, swollen, and often bulbous stem that resembles a thickened root, which helps it store water in arid environments. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are usually reduced to small stipules, giving it a peculiar appearance. This variant is adapted to rocky and coastal habitats, showcasing its resilience to harsh environmental conditions.
